member.name: T:Saraff.Twain.Tiff.TiffDirEntry
member.summary: TIFF Image File Directories are comprised of a table of field descriptors of the form shown below. The table is sorted in ascending order by tag. The values associated with each entry are disjoint and may appear anywhere in the file (so long as they are placed on a word boundary). If the value is 4 bytes or less, then it is placed in the offset field to save space. If the value is less than 4 bytes, it is left-justified in the offset field.

member.name: T:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities
member.summary: Набор возможностей (Capabilities).

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.DeviceEvent
member.summary: CAP_DEVICEEVENT. MSG_SET selects which events the application wants the source to report; MSG_RESET resets the capability to the empty array (no events set).

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.Alarms
member.summary: CAP_ALARMS. Turns specific audible alarms on and off.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AlarmVolume
member.summary: CAP_ALARMVOLUME. Controls the volume of a device’s audible alarm.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutomaticSenseMedium
member.summary: CAP_AUTOMATICSENSEMEDIUM. Configures a Source to check for paper in the Automatic Document Feeder.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutoDiscardBlankPages
member.summary: ICAP_AUTODISCARDBLANKPAGES. Discards blank pages.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutomaticBorderDetection
member.summary: ICAP_AUTOMATICBORDERDETECTION. Turns automatic border detection on and off.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutomaticColorEnabled
member.summary: ICAP_AUTOMATICCOLORENABLED. Detects the pixel type of the image and returns either a color image or a non-color image specified by ICAP_AUTOMATICCOLORNONCOLORPIXELTYPE.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutomaticColorNonColorPixelType
member.summary: ICAP_AUTOMATICCOLORNONCOLORPIXELTYPE. Specifies the non-color pixel type to use when automatic color is enabled.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutomaticCropUsesFrame
member.summary: ICAP_AUTOMATICCROPUSESFRAME. Reduces the amount of data captured from the device, potentially improving the performance of the driver.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutomaticDeskew
member.summary: ICAP_AUTOMATICDESKEW. Turns automatic skew correction on and off.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutomaticLengthDetection
member.summary: ICAP_AUTOMATICLENGTHDETECTION. Controls the automatic detection of the length of a document, this is intended for use with an Automatic Document Feeder.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutomaticRotate
member.summary: ICAP_AUTOMATICROTATE. When TRUE, depends on source to automatically rotate the image.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutoSize
member.summary: ICAP_AUTOSIZE. Force the output image dimensions to match either the current value of ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZES or any of its current allowed values.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.FlipRotation
member.summary: ICAP_FLIPROTATION. Orients images that flip orientation every other image.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.ImageMerge
member.summary: ICAP_IMAGEMERGE. Merges the front and rear image of a document in one of four orientations: front on the top.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.ImageMergeHeightThreshold
member.summary: ICAP_IMAGEMERGEHEIGHTTHRESHOLD. Specifies a Y-Offset in ICAP_UNITS units.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutomaticCapture
member.summary: CAP_AUTOMATICCAPTURE. Specifies the number of images to automatically capture.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.TimeBeforeFirstCapture
member.summary: CAP_TIMEBEFOREFIRSTCAPTURE. Selects the number of seconds before the first picture taken.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.TimeBetweenCaptures
member.summary: CAP_TIMEBETWEENCAPTURES. Selects the hundredths of a second to wait between pictures taken.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.AutoScan
member.summary: CAP_AUTOSCAN. Enables the source’s automatic document scanning process.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.CameraEnabled
member.summary: CAP_CAMERAENABLED. Delivers images from the current camera.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.CameraOrder
member.summary: CAP_CAMERAORDER. Selects the order of output for Single Document Multiple Image mode.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.CameraSide
member.summary: CAP_CAMERASIDE. Sets the top and bottom values of cameras in a scanning device.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.ClearBuffers
member.summary: CAP_CLEARBUFFERS. MSG_GET reports presence of data in scanner’s buffers; MSG_SET clears the buffers.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.MaxBatchBuffers
member.summary: CAP_MAXBATCHBUFFERS. Describes the number of pages that the scanner can buffer when CAP_AUTOSCAN is enabled.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.BarCodeDetectionEnabled
member.summary: ICAP_BARCODEDETECTIONENABLED. Turns bar code detection on and off.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.SupportedBarCodeTypes
member.summary: ICAP_SUPPORTEDBARCODETYPES. Provides a list of bar code types that can be detected by current data source.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.BarCodeMaxRetries
member.summary: ICAP_BARCODEMAXRETRIES. Restricts the number of times a search will be retried if no bar codes are found.

member.name: P:Saraff.Twain.TwainCapabilities.BarCodeMaxSearchPriorities
member.summary: ICAP_BARCODEMAXSEARCHPRIORITIES. Specifies the maximum number of supported search priorities.

member.name: T:Saraff.Twain.TwRC
member.summary: Return Codes

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.Success
member.summary: Operation was successful.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.Failure
member.summary: May be returned by any operation. An error has occurred.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.CheckStatus
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_CAPABILITY and DAT_IMAGELAYOUT. Operation failed to completely perform the desired operation. For example, setting ICAP_BRIGHTNESS to 3 when its range is -1000 to 1000 with a step of 200. The data source may opt to set the value to 0 and return this status.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.Cancel
member.summary: Intended for use with the DAT_IMAGE*XFER operations. Operation has been canceled.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.DSEvent
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_EVENT. The data source processed the event.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.NotDSEvent
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_EVENT. The data source did not process the event.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.XferDone
member.summary: Intended for use with the DAT_IMAGE*XFER operations. The image has been fully transferred.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.EndOfList
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_IDENTITY and DAT_FILESYSTEM.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.InfoNotSupported
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO. The requested TWEI_ data is either not supported by this data source, or is not supported for this particular image.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.DataNotAvailable
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO. There is no data available for the requested TWEI_ item.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.Busy
member.summary: The busy.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwRC.ScannerLocked
member.summary: The scanner locked.

member.name: T:Saraff.Twain.TwCC
member.summary: Condition Codes

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.Success
member.summary: Operation was successful. This value should only be paired with TWRC_SUCCESS.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.Bummer
member.summary: May be returned by any operation. The data source is in a critical state.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.LowMemory
member.summary: May be returned for any operation except ones that reduce state (DAT_PENDINGXFERS / MSG_ENDXER, DAT_PENDINGXFERS / MSG_RESET, DAT_USERINTERFACE / MSG_DISABLEDS, DAT_IDENTITY / MSG_CLOSEDS, DAT_PARENT / MSG_CLOSEDSM).

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.NoDS
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_IDENTITY / MSG_OPENDS. The device is not online.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.MaxConnections
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_IDENTITY / MSG_OPENDS. The data source cannot support any more connections to this device.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.OperationError
member.summary: The operation failed, but the user has already been informed by the data source.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.BadCap
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_CAPABILITY. Returned by pre-1.7 data sources to indicate that the capability is not supported, that the value was bad, or that the desired value could not be set at this time.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.BadProtocol
member.summary: May be returned by any operation. The requested DG_* / DAT_* / MSG_* is not supported by the data source.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.BadValue
member.summary: May be returned by any operation. The capability or operation has rejected the requested setting.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.SeqError
member.summary: The seq error.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.BadDest
member.summary: May be returned by any operation (save for the DAT_PARENT operations). The TW_IDENTITY for the destination (the data source) does not match any items opened by MSG_OPENDS.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.CapUnsupported
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_CAPABILITY. The capability is not supported.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.CapBadOperation
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_CAPABILITY. The capability does not support the requested operation.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.CapSeqError
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_CAPABILITY. The capability being MSG_SET or MSG_RESET cannot be modified due to a setting for a related capability. For instance, this may be returned by ICAP_CITTKFACTOR if ICAP_COMPRESSION is set to any value other than TWCP_GROUP32D.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.Denied
member.summary: Intended for DAT_IMAGEFILEXFER and DAT_FILESYSTEM, the specified file or directory cannot be modified or deleted.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.FileExists
member.summary: Intended for DAT_FILESYSTEM. The specified file or directory already exists.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.FileNotFound
member.summary: Intended for DAT_IMAGEFILEXFER and DAT_FILESYSTEM. The specified file or directory cannot be found.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.NotEmpty
member.summary: Intended for use with DAT_FILESYSTEM. Directory is in use, and cannot be deleted.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.PaperJam
member.summary: Intended for use with the DAT_IMAGE*XFER operations.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.PaperDoubleFeed
member.summary: Intended for use with the DAT_IMAGE*XFER operations.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.FileWriteError
member.summary: Intended for DAT_IMAGEFILEXFER and DAT_FILESYSTEM, the specified file or directory could not be written, usually indicating a disk full condition, though it may also indicate a file or directory that the user has no permission to write.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwCC.CheckDeviceOnline
member.summary: May be returned for any operation in state 4 or higher, except ones that reduce state (DAT_PENDINGXFERS / MSG_ENDXER, DAT_PENDINGXFERS / MSG_RESET, DAT_USERINTERFACE / MSG_DISABLEDS, DAT_IDENTITY / MSG_CLOSEDS, DAT_PARENT / MSG_CLOSEDSM).

member.summary: Intended for use with the DAT_IMAGE*XFER operations.

member.summary: Intended for use with the DAT_IMAGE*XFER operations.

member.summary: Intended for use with the DAT_IMAGE*XFER operations.

member.summary: Intended for use with the DAT_IMAGE*XFER operations.

member.summary: Intended for use with the DAT_IMAGE*XFER operations.

member.summary: Returns the Current, Default and Available settings for a capability.

member.summary: Allows the application to set the Current value of a capability.

member.summary: Returns the value of the Source’s preferred Default values.

member.summary: Returns the Current setting for a capability.

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwQC.Reset
member.summary: Returns the capability to its TWAIN Default (power-on) condition (i.e. all previous negotiation is ignored).

member.name: F:Saraff.Twain.TwQC.SetConstraint
member.summary: Allows the application to set the Current and Default value(s) and restrict the Available values to some subset of the Source’s power-on set of values. Sources are strongly encouraged to allow the application to set as many of its capabilities as possible, and further to reflect these changes in the Source’s user interface. This will ensure that the user can only select images with characteristics that are useful to the consuming application.
